title: Photography
text: As previously mentioned, my passion for travel truly blossomed when I arrived here in 2022. Below, you’ll find some of my favorite pictures captured during my journeys across the United States. While I may not claim to be the most skilled photographer, I wholeheartedly love the art and continuously strive to enhance my abilities.

title: Education
text: In August 2022, I embarked on my Master’s program in Nutrition Science at CWRU. The university is renowned for hosting one of the most exceptional nutrition programs globally and having an amazing professors. This program not only offers an array of courses but also promises to foster a diverse skill set, contributing to the development of various capabilities crucial for my academic and professional growth.

title: Education
text:
King Saud Medical City ~ 2018 - 2022

I started working here as a registered dietitian in 2018 till 2022 before I came here to the US to pursue a Master’s degree. I covered a lot of specialties during that time but mostly as an Intensive Care Unity [ICU] dietitian especially after COVID-19 started. Taking my master’s here has improved my overall nutrition knowledge, research skills, and critical thinking.

title: Education
section: King Saud University; College of Applied Medical Sciences ~ 2012-2018
text:
King Saud University; College of Applied Medical Sciences ~ 2012-2018

The College of Applied Medical Sciences was established in 1979 to meet the need in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia for qualified professionals in healthcare. It was the first college of applied medical sciences in the Kingdom at that time and has played a significant role in providing the workforce for both the private and public health sectors. Graduates are equipped with a high level of professional competence and modern knowledge and skills in healthcare. Currently, the college offers more than 12 undergraduate programs under seven main departments, and there are also postgraduate programs in various healthcare specialties. I started my BS program in 2012 and finished the coursework in 2017 then I started my internship for a whole year and finished it in 2018.

title: Welcome to my blog!
text:
Welcome to my blog!
My name's Naif Tuhaif AlQahtani and you can always call me by my first name Naif
I’m in my final year as an MSc student in the Nutrition program at Case Western Reserve University, School of Medicine, graduating next Spring.
Before I started my master’s program, I had my BS degree in Clinical Nutrition from the prestigious King Saud University, Riyadh, Saudia Arabia and I was working in one of the biggest medical cities in the Middle East region, King Saud Medical City as a registered dietitian. The fields that I have an interest in are sports nutrition, gut health and microbiome, and obesity. And hopefully one day, I will have the opportunity to pursue my PhD in these fields.
Embracing my passion for science, I find equal joy in exploring the world beyond the laboratory. Whether it’s embarking on adventurous hikes, relaxing by the shores of beautiful beaches, or immersing myself in the vibrant atmosphere of new destinations, I cherish the experiences that travel brings. In moments of leisure, I indulge in my love for sports, particularly football (aka soccer), savoring the thrill of matches. Additionally, my interests extend to a diverse array of entertainment, from captivating TV shows and engaging video games to the captivating narratives of anime. Life, to me, is a multifaceted journey blending the wonders of scientific exploration with the richness of diverse interests.
